titles.title: To amend the Veterans' Oral History Project Act to allow the collection of video and audio recordings of biographical histories by immediate family members of members of the Armed Forces who died as a result of their service during a period of war.
Gold Star Families Voices Act
Gold Star Families Voices Act

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on House Administration.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

action.text: Reported by the Committee on House Administration. H. Rept. 114-663.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 514.

action.text: Mr. Harper moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 4511.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Rules and Administration.
Senate Committee on Rules and Administration discharged pursuant to the order of 09/28/2016.
Measure laid before Senate by unanimous consent.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Yea-Nay Vote. 97 - 0. Record Vote Number: 152.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary:
(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The expanded summary of the House reported version is repeated here.)
Gold Star Families Voices Act
(Sec. 2) This bill amends the Veterans' Oral History Project Act to require the veterans oral history program to include the collection of video and audio recordings of biographical histories by immediate family members of members of the Armed Forces who became missing in action or who died as a result of their wartime service.
